  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: A supersac containing (4) burlap bags of hazardous product, Del Quench USEV, were punctured by a forklift resulting in a 3lb release onto the wooden trailer floor and concrete dock floor. A contractor containerized the damaged product into (2) 55DF's for waste disposal. No storm-drains, waterways, or soil were impacted by the release.

item.title: Report E-2024020366
item.description:
Report E-2024020366

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-20T15:11:27+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-08
  • City: GREENSBORO
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On May 2, 2024, one (1) 15-gallon drum of UN2924 was damaged in transit and released approximately one (1) gallon of product to the nose of the trailer. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from First Call Environmental (FCE) to remediate the impacted site. FCE personnel utilized cleaners and absorbent pads to the UN2924-impacted trailer interior and placed them in one (1) 5-gallon bucket for transport and disposal.

item.title: Report X-2024021236
item.description:
Report X-2024021236

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-20T15:11:27+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-09
  • City: CONCORD
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: PACKAGE WAS BROUGHT TO US BY THE LOAD SIDE MANAGER AND IT WAS ALREADY IN A LINED TOTE. THE SIDE WALL OF ONE OF THE TWO JUGS HAD A 3" CRACK DOWN THE SIDE WHICH IS WHAT CAUSED THE LEAKING TO OCCUR. THE LEAKING JUG CAUSED THE OTHER JUG TO BECOME CONTAMINTED AS WELL. DescribePack: 3 INCH CRACK DOWN ONE SIDE OF THE JUG DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: WE MADE SURE TO GET THE PACKAGE INTO THE HAZMAT CAGE

item.title: Report E-2024020337
item.description:
Report E-2024020337

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-16T15:14:16+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-09
  • City: GREENSBORO
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On February 9, 2024, one (1) 55-gallon drum of paint was damaged by a forklift and released approximately twenty-five (25) gallons of paint to the trailer interior and dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from First Call Environmental (FCE) to remediate the impacted site. Crews collected the absorbents used by the terminal staff and deployed more as needed to the dock, trailer, and pavement surfaces. The damaged drum was placed into an 85-gallon salvage drum for disposal. All impacted absorbents and solid waste was collected and contianerized into one (1) 55-gallon poly drum. FCE remediated staining on the dock floor and pavement to the extent practicable with paint thinner and acetone. Both waste drums were labeled and staged onsite.

item.title: Report X-2024020947
item.description:
Report X-2024020947

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-16T15:14:16+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-06
  • City: CHARLOTTE
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: PKG WAS BEING UNLOADED AND APPARENTLY PLACED ON THE BELT AND THERE WAS VISIBLE DAMAGE. PKG WAS QUICKLY SECURED IN A YELLOW HAZMAT DRUM AND SEALED DUE TO THE STRONG ODOR OF THE CONTENTS. PKG WAS LATER INVESTIGATED AT THE QA DAMAGE TABLE AFTER THE SORT. DescribePack: MISHANDLING AND TOO MUCH REHANDLE WAS THE CAUSE. PKG HAS BEEN RECYCLING FOR 2 WEEKS BACK AND FORTH FROM THE SHIPPER DUE TO IMPORPER PAPERWORK. BOTTLE INSIDE WAS GLASS SO IT WAS EITHER DROPPED OR THROWN ONTO THE BELT, CAUSING IT TO BREAK. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: ENTIRE PKG WAS PLACED IN A HAZMAT DRUM AND SEALED AND SECURED AWAY FROM STATION EMPLOYEE.

item.title: Report I-2024020060
item.description:
Report I-2024020060

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-22T15:12:23+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-31
  • City: Greensboro
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: SOUTHEASTERN FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: During the unloading phase of trailer, employee was attempting to unload a pallet of freight with a forklift, the forklift blades were protruding past the pallet and punctured a pail in front of the pallet. Contact was made at the bottom side of the pail putting a 1.5 inch long puncture in the pail. Pail was then removed and placed in a position to where the material would not leak further. All spillage of material was confined to immediate area for cleanup

item.title: Report X-2024020608
item.description:
Report X-2024020608

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-20T15:11:27+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-24
  • City: RAEFORD
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: UPON ARRIVAL TO THE TERMINAL, PACKAGE WAS PULLED FROM THE TRAILOR AS WET AND GIVEN TO THE QA'S TO INSPECT. AFTER INSPECTING, IT WAS FOUND TO BE AN OPEN BOTTLE AND CRUSHED BOTTLE OF ADVANCED CHEMICAL OVEN AND GRILL CLEANER THAT EVENTUALLY ATE THROUGH THE BOX. DescribePack: LIMITED INNER PACKING. JUST PUT IN A PLASTIC BAG WITH A PARTITION SEPARATING THE BOTTLES. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: WHEN DISCOVERED, PACKAGE WAS PLACE IN A DAMAGE BIN

item.title: Report X-2024020786
item.description:
Report X-2024020786

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-16T15:14:16+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-30
  • City: CONCORD
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: IC belt manger contacted QA, to inspect a potential hazmat leaking package. Upon inspection, we noticed that one of the bottles had a loose cap which spilled out and contaminated the entire package contents. We responded within five minutes of the call and isolated this package in a lined hazmat tote and then moved it to the hazmat cage. DescribePack: Loose cap DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Responded quickly to the call and isolated the hazmat package within the hazmat cage.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: As driver was on their route, Hazmat package tipped over and cracked the seal causing it to spill out 4 gallons of hazardous liquid onto about 25 non hazardous packages. All 25 packages were damaged. Driver alerted FedEx while on the road and when they returned QA cleaned up liquid and removed all damaged packages. DescribePack: Lid cracked DurationRel: 2 and MitigateEffect: Used absorbent pads for li

item.title: Report X-2024020456
item.description:
Report X-2024020456

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-16T00:33:09+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-23
  • City: RAEFORD
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: UPON ARRIVAL TO THE TERMINAL, PACKAGE WAS FOUND WET AND SMELLING STRONGLY, PUT IN A DAMAGE BIN, AND GIVEN TO THE QA TEAM FOR INSPECTION. AFTER INSPECTING, IT WAS FOUND THAT THE CANS HAD BEEN DENTED/CRUSHED ALONG WITH THE PRODUCT FROM WITH IN SEAPED OUT OF THE CANS. THE CAPS WERE ON TIGHT BUT MAY HAVE BEEN MISALIGNED. DescribePack: NO PACKAGING FAILURES. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: WHEN THE PACKAGE WAS FOUND, IT WAS GIVEN TO THE QA'S AND PLACED IN A DAMAGE BIN UNTIL A HAZMAT CONTAINER WAS FOUND TO CONTROL THE STRONG SMELL.

item.title: Report X-2024020440
item.description:
Report X-2024020440

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-16T00:33:09+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-19
  • City: WILMINGTON
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The actual sequence of events that led up to the damaged package incident is unknown, but once package had been discovered, immediate action was taken to isolate the package within the hazmat processing cage for further processing and examination. DescribePack: Two bags of granular fungicide powder had some ripping and tearing along the seams of the bag closure, which caused the leakage. DurationRel: 2 and MitigateEffect: Once package was discovered, action was taken to isolate the damaged package in the Hazmat Processing cage for further investigation and processing.

item.title: Report X-2024020279
item.description:
Report X-2024020279

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-16T00:33:09+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-11
  • City: RAEFORD
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was loaded on vehicle for delivery driver saw package leaking at 11:30am and immediately placed package in plastic bag. Once driver returned to station, he turned it in to VSA to be processed accordingly. DescribePack: The cap on top of gallon did not close properly and caused it to leak. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Placed in a plastic bag inside vehicle.
